meta.name: @doccov/sdk
meta.description: DocCov SDK - Documentation coverage and drift detection for TypeScript

exports.name: ALL_VALIDATIONS
exports.description: All validations (used when --examples is passed without values).

members.name: fromCache
members.description: True if result came from cache (no fresh analysis)

members.name: cacheStatus
members.description: Cache validation details (if cache was checked)

members.name: forgottenExports
members.description: Forgotten exports (types referenced but not exported)

exports.name: analyzeDocsImpact
exports.description: Analyze docs impact from a spec diff

tags.name: param
tags.text: All export names in the new spec (for missing docs detection)

tags.name: param
tags.text: Optional member-level changes for granular detection

exports.name: analyzeProject
exports.description:
Analyze a project's structure for scanning.

This is the main entry point for project detection. It combines all
detection functions into a single call that returns complete project info.

For monorepos, you must specify the target package via options.targetPackage.
If not specified and a monorepo is detected, an error is thrown with the
list of available packages.

tags.name: throws
tags.text: Error if monorepo detected without targetPackage specified

tags.name: throws
tags.text: Error if targetPackage not found in monorepo

tags.name: example

exports.name: AnalyzeProjectOptions
exports.description: Options for analyzeProject()

exports.description: Apply a batch of edits to source files

exports.description: Result of applying edits to source files

exports.name: applyForgottenExportFixes
exports.description:
Apply forgotten export fixes to files.
Reads files, finds best insertion points, and applies edits.

exports.name: ApplyForgottenExportResult

exports.name: applyPatchToJSDoc
exports.description: Apply a partial patch to an existing JSDoc patch, preserving unmodified content

exports.description: Build a clone URL from parsed components.

tags.name: example

examples.code:
const cloneUrl = buildCloneUrl({ owner: 'vercel', repo: 'next.js', ref: 'main' });
// 'https://github.com/vercel/next.js.git'

exports.name: buildDisplayUrl
exports.description: Build a display-friendly URL (without protocol or .git suffix).

tags.name: example

examples.code:
const displayUrl = buildDisplayUrl({ owner: 'vercel', repo: 'next.js', ref: 'main' });
// 'github.com/vercel/next.js'

exports.name: calculateAggregateCoverage
exports.description:
Calculate aggregate coverage score from a spec's exports.

This is a lightweight function that calculates coverage without
requiring full quality evaluation. It handles three cases:
1. Exports with `docs.coverageScore` - uses that value
2. Exports without score but with description - counts as 100%
3. Exports without score and no description - counts as 0%

tags.name: param
tags.text: The OpenPkg spec to calculate coverage for

tags.name: example

exports.description: Extended drift with category and fixability metadata.

members.name: examples
members.description:
Example validation modes to run.
Can be a single mode, array of modes, or comma-separated string.
- 'presence': Check that

tags.name: example
tags.text:
blocks exist on exports
- 'typecheck': Compile examples with TypeScript
- 'run': Execute examples and validate assertions

exports.name: CommandRunner
exports.description:
Function that runs a shell command.
Abstracts the difference between Node.js execSync and Sandbox runCommand.

exports.description: Compute drift for a single export.

tags.text: Registry of known exports and types for validation

exports.name: computeHealth
exports.description:
Compute unified documentation health score.

Formula: health = completeness  (1 - drift_ratio  0.5)
- Max 50% drift penalty
- Optional 30% example penalty if examples validated

Score thresholds: green 80+, yellow 60-79, red <60

exports.name: computeSnapshot
exports.description: Compute a coverage snapshot from an OpenPkg spec.

exports.name: createNodeCommandRunner
exports.description:
Create a command runner for Node.js environments using execSync.
This is used by the CLI for local dependency installation.

tags.name: example

examples.code:
const runner = createNodeCommandRunner();
const result = await runner('npm', ['install'], { cwd: '/path/to/repo' });

Define a DocCov configuration.

tags.text: Build info including scripts and exotic indicators

exports.name: DetectedPackageManager
exports.description: Detected package manager from lockfile.

exports.name: DetectedSchemaEntry
exports.description: Pre-detected Standard Schema for a variable export.

exports.name: detectEntryPoint
exports.description:
Detect the TypeScript entry point for a package.

Priority order:
1. package.json -> types or typings field
2. package.json -> exports["."].types
3. package.json -> main field (resolve to .ts)
4. package.json -> module field (resolve to .ts)
5. Common fallback paths

tags.name: throws
tags.text: Error if no entry point can be found

exports.name: detectExampleAssertionFailures
exports.description: Detect assertion failures by comparing stdout to expected values.

exports.name: detectExampleRuntimeErrors
exports.description: Detect runtime errors in

tags.name: example
tags.text:
blocks.
Results are provided externally after running examples via runExamples().

examples.code:
blocks.
Results are provided externally after running examples via runExamples().

exports.name: detectMonorepo
exports.description:
Detect if a project is a monorepo and list its packages.

Detection triggers (in order):
1. package.json has workspaces field (npm/yarn)
2. pnpm-workspace.yaml exists
3. lerna.json exists

exports.name: detectPackageManager
exports.description:
Detect package manager based on lockfile presence and package.json hints.

Resolution order:
1. packageManager field in package.json (e.g., "pnpm@9.0.0")
2. Most recently modified lockfile (when multiple exist)
3. Static priority order: pnpm > bun > yarn > npm
4. Default to npm

members.name: tryLoadFromCache
members.description:
Try to load spec from cache.
Returns null if cache is invalid or doesn't exist.

members.name: getCurrentSourceFiles
members.description:
Get current source files from a fresh TypeScript program.
Used for cache validation to detect new files.

members.name: findTsConfig
members.description: Find tsconfig.json starting from a directory.

members.name: findPackageJson
members.description: Find package.json starting from a directory.

members.name: detectSchemas
members.description:
Detect Standard Schema exports from compiled modules.
Only runs when schemaExtraction is 'runtime' or 'hybrid'.
Returns undefined if detection is disabled, fails, or no schemas found.

exports.name: DocCovConfig
exports.description:
Normalized DocCov configuration.
This is the parsed/normalized form used by commands.

members.name: schemaExtraction
members.description:
Schema extraction mode for validation libraries.

- 'static' (default): Safe, uses TypeScript Compiler API
- 'runtime': Uses Standard Schema (requires built package)
- 'hybrid': Tries runtime first, falls back to static

Runtime extraction provides richer JSON Schema output (formats, patterns)
but requires the package to be built first.

members.name: cwd
members.description: Working directory for cache operations (default: process.cwd())

members.name: schemaExtraction
members.description:
Schema extraction mode for validation libraries (Zod, Valibot, etc.)

- 'static' (default): TypeScript Compiler API only (no runtime)
- 'runtime': Standard Schema runtime extraction (requires built package)
- 'hybrid': Try runtime first, fall back to static

exports.name: DocCovReport
exports.description:
DocCov report - a persistable coverage analysis result.

This is the format saved to `.doccov/report.json` and returned
by the `check` command with `--format json`.

Drift report with progressive disclosure structure.

Provides three levels of detail:
1. Summary - total counts by category
2. By category - grouped drift issues
3. All - flat list for backward compatibility

exports.name: ensureSpecCoverage
exports.description:
Ensure a spec has a top-level docs.coverageScore.

If the spec already has `docs.coverageScore`, returns the spec unchanged.
Otherwise, calculates aggregate coverage from exports and returns a
new spec with the coverage score added.

This is useful for commands like `diff` that need coverage scores
but may receive raw specs that haven't been enriched.

tags.name: param
tags.text: The OpenPkg spec to ensure coverage for

tags.name: returns
tags.text: The spec with guaranteed top-level coverage score

tags.name: example

exports.name: getDiffReportPath

examples.code:
getDiffReportPath('abc123def456', 'xyz789uvw012', 'markdown');
// '.doccov/diff-abc123de-xyz789uv.md'

exports.name: groupDriftsByCategory
exports.description: Group drifts by category.

tags.name: param
tags.text: Array of drift issues to group

tags.name: example
tags.text:
```ts
const grouped = groupDriftsByCategory(spec.docs.drift ?? []);
console.log(grouped.structural.length); // Number of structural issues
console.log(grouped.semantic.length);   // Number of semantic issues
console.log(grouped.example.length);    // Number of example issues
```

examples.code:
const grouped = groupDriftsByCategory(spec.docs.drift ?? []);
console.log(grouped.structural.length); // Number of structural issues
console.log(grouped.semantic.length);   // Number of semantic issues
console.log(grouped.example.length);    // Number of example issues

Compute a hash of file contents.

Check if code contains comments that are not assertion syntax.

exports.name: installDependencies
exports.description:
Install dependencies for a project.

This consolidates the install logic from CLI scan.ts and API scan-stream.ts:
1. Detect package manager from lockfile
2. Try primary install command
3. Fall back to other package managers if primary fails

tags.name: param
tags.text: FileSystem implementation for package manager detection

tags.name: example

exports.name: InstallOptions
exports.description: Options for dependency installation.

members.description: Timeout in milliseconds for install commands (default: 180000)

members.description: Order of fallback package managers to try

exports.description: Result of dependency installation.

tags.name: param
tags.text: The DocCov spec containing analysis data

tags.name: returns
tags.text: True if export has 100% coverage and no drift

exports.name: isFixableDrift
exports.description: Check if a drift type can be fixed deterministically

exports.name: isStandardJSONSchema
exports.description:
Check if an object implements StandardJSONSchemaV1.
This is a static type guard - doesn't require runtime.

exports.name: JSDocEdit
exports.description: Represents an edit to be applied to a source file

exports.name: JSDocParam
exports.description: Represents a single parameter in a JSDoc patch

exports.name: JSDocReturn
exports.description: Represents a return type in a JSDoc patch

exports.name: JSDocTag
exports.description: Represents a generic tag in a JSDoc patch

exports.name: listWorkspacePackages
exports.description: List packages in a monorepo workspace.

exports.name: LLMAssertion
exports.description: LLM-parsed assertion from non-standard comment syntax.

exports.name: loadCachedReport
exports.description: Load a cached DocCov report from disk.

tags.name: param
tags.text: Path to the report file (defaults to .doccov/report.json)

tags.name: returns
tags.text: The cached report, or null if not found

exports.name: loadSnapshots
exports.description: Load all historical snapshots.

tags.name: returns
tags.text: Array of snapshots sorted by timestamp (most recent first)

exports.name: loadSpecCache
exports.description: Load cached spec from disk.

tags.name: returns
tags.text: Cached spec, or null if not found or invalid JSON

exports.name: MarkdownCodeBlock
exports.description: Markdown/MDX documentation analysis types

members.name: lang
members.description: Language tag (ts, typescript, js, javascript, tsx, jsx)

members.name: meta
members.description: Raw meta string from code fence (e.g., "title=example.ts")

members.name: lineStart
members.description: Starting line number in the markdown file

members.name: lineEnd
members.description: Ending line number in the markdown file

exports.name: MarkdownDocFile
exports.description: A parsed markdown documentation file

members.name: path
members.description: File path relative to project root

members.name: className
members.description: The class this member belongs to

exports.name: mergeFilters
exports.description:
Merge filter options from config and CLI/API overrides.

Merge behavior:
- Include: CLI values intersect with config values (narrowing)
- Exclude: CLI values are added to config values (expanding)

tags.name: param
tags.text: Override filters (from CLI flags or API params)

tags.name: example

exports.name: mergeFixes
exports.description: Merge multiple fix patches into a single patch

exports.name: MonorepoInfo
exports.description: Monorepo detection result

exports.name: MonorepoType
exports.description: Monorepo type based on configuration

exports.name: NodeFileSystem
exports.description:
Node.js filesystem implementation for CLI usage.
Wraps Node.js fs module with a base path.

exports.name: PackageExports
exports.description: Package.json exports field structure.

exports.name: PackageJson
exports.description: Standard package.json structure for detection purposes.

exports.name: PackageManager
exports.description: Supported package managers

exports.name: PackageManagerInfo
exports.description: Package manager detection result with install/run commands

members.name: lockfile
members.description: Lockfile that was detected (null if none found)

members.name: runPrefix
members.description: Prefix for running scripts, e.g. ['npm', 'run'] or ['pnpm']

exports.name: parseAssertions
exports.description:
Parse assertion comments from example code.
Matches: // => expected_value

exports.name: ParsedGitHubUrl
exports.description: Parsed components of a GitHub URL.

exports.name: parseExamplesFlag
exports.description: Parse --examples flag value into validation set.

examples.code:
parseExamplesFlag(true)                  // ['presence', 'typecheck', 'run']
parseExamplesFlag('presence')            // ['presence']
parseExamplesFlag('typecheck,run')       // ['typecheck', 'run']
parseExamplesFlag(undefined)             // [] (no validation)

exports.name: parseGitHubUrl
exports.description:
Parse a GitHub URL or shorthand into components.

Supported formats:
- https://github.com/owner/repo
- https://github.com/owner/repo/tree/branch
- https://github.com/owner/repo/tree/v1.0.0
- github.com/owner/repo
- owner/repo (shorthand)
- git@github.com:owner/repo.git

tags.name: param
tags.text: Default ref if not specified in URL (default: 'main')

tags.name: throws
tags.text: Error if the URL format is invalid

tags.name: example

exports.name: parseGitHubUrl
exports.description:
Parse GitHub URL into owner and repo.
Uses the richer parseGitHubUrl from github/index.ts, returning null on error.

exports.name: parseJSDocToPatch
exports.description: Parse a JSDoc comment string into a patchable structure

exports.name: parseListFlag
exports.description: Parse a comma-separated list flag into an array.

tags.name: param
tags.text: String or string array from CLI flag

tags.name: returns
tags.text: Parsed array, or undefined if empty

examples.code:
parseListFlag('a,b,c'); // ['a', 'b', 'c']
parseListFlag(['a,b', 'c']); // ['a', 'b', 'c']
parseListFlag(undefined); // undefined

exports.name: parseMarkdownFile
exports.description: Parse a markdown file and extract code blocks

exports.name: parseMarkdownFiles
exports.description: Parse multiple markdown files

exports.name: PresenceResult
exports.description: Result of example presence validation.

exports.name: previewForgottenExportFixes
exports.description:
Preview forgotten export fixes without applying them.
Returns a map of file paths to the changes that would be made.

exports.name: ProjectInfo
exports.description: Complete project analysis result

exports.name: pruneHistory
exports.description: Prune old snapshots to keep history manageable.

exports.name: readPackageJson
exports.description: Read and parse package.json from a directory.

exports.name: ReleaseTag
exports.description:
Release stage/visibility tags that can be used for filtering.
Based on TSDoc release tags.

exports.name: renderApiSurface
exports.description:
Generate a git-trackable API surface markdown file from an OpenPkg spec.

This produces a deterministic, sorted output suitable for version control.
Changes to the API will show up as diffs in this file.

tags.name: returns
tags.text: Markdown string representing the API surface

tags.name: example

exports.name: renderSparkline
exports.description: Generate a sparkline character representation.

exports.name: REPORT_EXTENSIONS
exports.description: File extensions for each report format.

exports.name: REPORT_VERSION
exports.description: DocCov report schema version.

exports.name: resolveCompiledPath
exports.description:
Resolve compiled JS path from TypeScript source.
Tries common output locations: dist/, build/, lib/, same dir.

exports.name: ResolvedFilters
exports.description: Resolved filter options after merging config and overrides.

members.name: fromConfig
members.description: Whether filters were applied from config

members.name: fromOverride
members.description: Whether filters were applied from overrides

exports.name: ResolvedTarget
exports.description: Result of resolving a target package/entry point.

members.name: packageInfo
members.description: Package info if this is a monorepo package

exports.name: resolveTarget
exports.description:
Resolve a target package and entry point.

This consolidates the repeated pattern from CLI commands:
1. If --package specified, detect monorepo and find the package
2. If no entry specified, auto-detect entry point
3. If entry is a directory, detect entry point within it

tags.name: throws
tags.text: Error if monorepo package not found, or entry point detection fails

tags.name: example

exports.name: ResolveTargetOptions
exports.description: Options for resolving a target package/entry point.

members.name: entry
members.description: Explicit entry point path (relative to cwd or package dir)

exports.name: runExample
exports.description:
Run an example code snippet in an isolated Node process.
Uses Node 22+ --experimental-strip-types for direct TS execution.

exports.name: runExamples
exports.description: Run multiple examples and collect results

exports.name: runExamplesWithPackage
exports.description:
Run multiple examples with a pre-installed local package.
Creates a single temp directory, installs the package once,
runs all examples, then cleans up.

members.name: packagePath
members.description: Path to the local package to install

members.name: packageManager
members.description: Package manager to use (auto-detected if not specified)

members.name: installTimeout
members.description: Timeout for package installation in ms (default: 60000)

members.name: results
members.description: Results for each example by index

exports.name: RuntimeDrift
exports.description: Runtime drift issue (runtime error or assertion failure).

exports.name: RunValidationResult
exports.description: Result of example runtime validation.

exports.name: safeParseJson
exports.description: Safely parse a JSON file, returning null on any error.

exports.name: SandboxFileSystem
exports.description:
Vercel Sandbox filesystem implementation for API usage.
Uses sandbox.runCommand() with shell commands.

exports.name: saveReport
exports.description: Save a DocCov report to disk.

tags.name: param
tags.text: Path to save the report (defaults to .doccov/report.json)

exports.name: saveSnapshot
exports.description: Save a coverage snapshot to history.

exports.name: saveSpecCache
exports.description: Save spec to cache.

tags.name: param
tags.text: Cache context with file paths and config

exports.name: SchemaAdapter
exports.description:
A schema adapter can detect and extract output types from a specific
schema validation library.

members.name: packages
members.description: npm package name(s) this adapter handles

members.name: matches
members.description:
Check if a type matches this adapter's schema library.
Should be fast - called for every export.

members.name: extractOutputType
members.description:
Extract the output type from a schema type.
Returns null if extraction fails.

members.name: extractInputType
members.description:
Extract the input type from a schema type (optional).
Useful for transforms where input differs from output.

members.name: noCompiledJsWarning
members.description: Warning when runtime was requested but compiled JS not found

exports.name: SchemaExtractionMode
exports.description:
Schema extraction modes for validation libraries (Zod, Valibot, TypeBox, ArkType).

- 'static': TypeScript Compiler API only (no runtime, always safe)
- 'runtime': Standard Schema runtime extraction (requires built package)
- 'hybrid': Try runtime first, fall back to static

exports.name: SchemaExtractionResult
exports.description: Result of schema type extraction

members.name: inputType
members.description: The extracted input type (if different from output)

exports.name: serializeJSDoc
exports.description: Serialize a JSDocPatch back to a formatted comment string

exports.name: shouldValidate
exports.description: Check if a specific validation is enabled.

exports.name: SPEC_CACHE_FILE
exports.description: Default cache file path

exports.name: SpecCache
exports.description: Cached spec with validation metadata.

members.name: entryFile
members.description: Entry file that was analyzed (relative path)

exports.name: SpecCacheConfig
exports.description: Configuration that affects spec generation output.

exports.name: SpecDiffWithDocs
exports.description: Extended spec diff result with docs impact

members.name: docsImpact
members.description: Docs impact analysis (only present if markdown files provided)

members.name: driftIntroduced
members.description: Number of new drift issues introduced

exports.name: SpecSummary
exports.description:
Summary of a spec's documentation coverage.
Simpler than full ReportStats - focused on scan output.

members.name: undocumented
members.description: Names of undocumented or partially documented exports

exports.name: StandardJSONSchemaV1
exports.description: Standard JSON Schema v1 interface (minimal for detection).

exports.name: StandardSchemaExtractionOutput
exports.description: Result of Standard Schema extraction.

exports.name: StandardSchemaExtractionResult
exports.description: Result of extracting Standard Schema from an export.

exports.name: SummaryDriftIssue
exports.description: A documentation drift issue in a spec summary.

members.name: export
members.description: Name of the export with drift

members.name: suggestion
members.description: Optional suggestion for fixing the issue

exports.name: typecheckExample
exports.description: Type-check a single example

exports.name: typecheckExamples
exports.description: Type-check multiple examples

members.name: tsconfig
members.description: Path to tsconfig.json (auto-detected if not provided)

members.name: packageName
members.description: Package name for imports (auto-detected from package.json if not provided)

members.name: exportNames
members.description: Export names to include in the virtual import statement

members.name: errors
members.description: All type errors found across examples

exports.name: TypecheckValidationResult
exports.description: Result of example typecheck validation.

exports.name: validateExamples
exports.description:
Validate examples across exports.

Runs only the validations specified. Each validation is independent:
- `presence`: checks examples exist (doesn't require typecheck or run)
- `typecheck`: type-checks examples (doesn't require presence or run)
- `run`: executes examples (doesn't require presence or typecheck)

exports.name: validateSpecCache
exports.description:
Validate if cached spec is still valid.

Checks:
1. Cache version matches
2. Entry file matches
3. Config matches
4. tsconfig.json hash matches
5. package.json hash matches
6. All source file hashes match

exports.name: VALIDATION_INFO
exports.description: Describes what each validation does.

exports.name: WorkspaceConfig
exports.description: Workspace/monorepo configuration.

exports.name: WorkspacePackage
exports.description: A package within a monorepo workspace

members.name: private
members.description: Whether the package is marked as private
